definitions: Group together some data entities on the basis of similarities such that entities in the same group (cluster) are more similar to each other than to those in other groups (clusters).

label: Conversion
definitions: Convert a data set from one form to another.

label: Standardisation and normalisation
definitions: Standardize or normalize data by some statistical method.

In the simplest normalisation means adjusting values measured on different scales to a common scale (often between 0.0 and 1.0), but can refer to more sophisticated adjustment whereby entire probability distributions of adjusted values are brought into alignment. Standardisation typically refers to an operation whereby a range of values are standardised to measure how many standard deviations a value is from its mean.

label: Aggregation
definitions: Combine multiple files or data items into a single file or object.

label: Article comparison
definitions: Compare two or more scientific articles.

label: Calculation
definitions: Mathematical determination of the value of something, typically a properly of a  molecule.

label: Pathway or network prediction
definitions: Predict a molecular pathway or network.

label: Image analysis
definitions: The analysis of a image (typically a digital image) of some type in order to extract information from it.

label: Diffraction data analysis
definitions: Analysis of data from a diffraction experiment.

label: Cell migration analysis
definitions: Analysis of cell migration images in order to study cell migration, typically in order to study the processes that play a role in the disease progression.

label: Diffraction data reduction
definitions: Processing of diffraction data into a corrected, ordered, and simplified form.

label: Neurite measurement
definitions: Measurement of neurites; projections (axons or dendrites) from the cell body of a neuron, from analysis of neuron images.

label: Diffraction data integration
definitions: The evaluation of diffraction intensities and integration of diffraction maxima from a diffraction experiment.

label: Phasing
definitions: Phase a macromolecular crystal structure, for example by using molecular replacement or experimental phasing methods.

label: Molecular replacement
definitions: A technique used to construct an atomic model of an unknown structure from diffraction data, based upon an atomic model of a known structure, either a related protein or the same protein from a different crystal form.
The technique solves the phase problem, i.e. retrieve information concern phases of the structure.

label: Rigid body refinement
definitions: A method used to refine a structure by moving the whole molecule or parts of it as a rigid unit, rather than moving individual atoms.
Rigid body refinement usually follows molecular replacement in the assignment of a structure from diffraction data.

label: Single particle analysis
definitions: An image processing technique that combines and analyze multiple images of a particulate sample, in order to produce an image with clearer features that are more easily interpreted.

Single particle analysis is used to improve the information that can be obtained by relatively low resolution techniques, , e.g. an image of a protein or virus from transmission electron microscopy (TEM).

label: Single particle alignment and classification
definitions: Compare (align and classify) multiple particle images from a micrograph in order to produce a representative image of the particle.

A micrograph can include particles in multiple different orientations and/or conformations. Particles are compared and organised into sets based on their similarity. Typically iterations of classification and alignment and are performed to optimise the final 3D EM map.

label: Functional clustering
definitions: Clustering of molecular sequences on the basis of their function, typically using information from an ontology of gene function, or some other measure of functional phenotype.

label: Taxonomic classification
definitions: Classifiication (typically of molecular sequences) by assignment to some taxonomic hierarchy.

label: Virulence prediction
definitions: The prediction of the degree of pathogenicity of a microorganism from analysis of molecular sequences.

label: Gene expression correlation
definitions: Analyse the correlation patterns among genes across across a variety of experiments, microarray samples etc.

label: Correlation
definitions: Identify a correlation, i.e. a statistical relationship between two random variables or two sets of data.

label: RNA structure covariance model generation
definitions: Compute the covariance model for (a family of) RNA secondary structures.

label: k-mer counting
definitions: Count k-mers (substrings of length k) in DNA sequence data.
k-mer counting is used in genome and transcriptome assembly, metagenomic sequencing, and for error correction of sequence reads.

label: Phylogenetic tree reconstruction
definitions: Reconstructing the inner node labels of a phylogenetic tree from its leafes.
Note that this is somewhat different from simply analysing an existing tree or constructing a completely new one.

label: Probabilistic data generation
definitions: Generate some data from a choosen probibalistic model, possibly to evaluate algorithms.

label: Probabilistic sequence generation
definitions: Generate sequences from some probabilistic model, e.g. a model that simulates evolution.

label: Antimicrobial resistance prediction
definitions: Identify or predict causes for antibiotic resistance from molecular sequence analysis.

label: Enrichment analysis
definitions: Analysis of a set of objects, such as genes, annotated with given categories, where eventual over-/under-representation of certain categories within the studied set of objects is revealed.

Categories from a relevant ontology can be used. The input is typically a set of genes or other biological objects, possibly represented by their identifiers, and the output of the analysis is typically a ranked list of categories, each associated with a statistical metric of over-/under-representation within the studied data.

label: Chemical similarity enrichment
definitions: Analyse a dataset with respect to concepts from an ontology of chemical structure, leveraging chemical similarity information.

label: Incident curve plotting
definitions: Plot an incident curve such as a survival curve, death curve, mortality curve.

label: Variant pattern analysis
definitions: Identify and map patterns of genomic variations.
Methods often utilise a database of aligned reads.

label: Microscope image visualisation
definitions: Visualise images resulting from various types of microscopy.

label: Image annotation
definitions: Annotate an image of some sort, typically with terms from a controlled vocabulary.

label: Imputation
definitions: Replace missing data with substituted values, usually by using some statistical or other mathematical approach.

label: Ontology visualisation
definitions: Visualise, format or render data from an ontology, typically a tree of terms.

label: Maximum occurence analysis
definitions: A method for making numerical assessments about the maximum percent of time that a conformer of a flexible macromolecule can exist and still be compatible with the experimental data.

label: Database comparison
definitions: Compare the models or schemas used by two or more databases, or any other general comparison of databases rather than a detailed comparison of the entries themselves.

label: Network simulation
definitions: Simulate the bevaviour of a biological pathway or network.

label: RNA-seq read count analysis
definitions: Analyze read counts from RNA-seq experiments.

label: Chemical redundancy removal
definitions: Identify and remove redudancy from a set of small molecule structures.

label: RNA-seq time series data analysis
definitions: Analyze time series data from an RNA-seq experiment.

label: Simulated gene expression data generation
definitions: Simulate gene expression data, e.g. for purposes of benchmarking.

label: Relation extraction
definitions: Identify semantic relations among entities and concepts within a text, using text mining techniques.

label: Mass spectra calibration
definitions: Re-adjust the output of mass spectrometry experiments with shifted ppm values.

label: Chromatographic alignment
definitions: Align multiple data sets using information from chromatography and/or peptide identification, from mass spectrometry experiments.

label: Deisotoping
definitions: The removal of isotope peaks in a spectrum, to represent the fragment ion as one data point.
Deisotoping is commonly done to reduce complexity, and done in conjunction with the charge state deconvolution.

label: Protein quantification
definitions: Technique for determining the amount of proteins in a sample.

label: Peptide identification
definitions: Determination of peptide sequence from mass spectrum.

label: Isotopic distributions calculation
definitions: Calculate the isotope distribution of a given chemical species.

label: Retention time prediction
definitions: Prediction of retention time in a mass spectrometry experiment based on compositional and structural properties of the separated species.

label: Label-free quantification
definitions: Quantification without the use of chemical tags.

label: Labeled quantification
definitions: Quantification based on the use of chemical tags.

label: MRM/SRM
definitions: Quantification by Selected/multiple Reaction Monitoring workflow (XIC quantitation of precursor / fragment mass pair).

label: Spectral counting
definitions: Calculate number of identified MS2 spectra as approximation of peptide / protein quantity.

label: SILAC
definitions: Quantification analysis using stable isotope labeling by amino acids in cell culture.

label: iTRAQ
definitions: Quantification analysis using the AB SCIEX iTRAQ isobaric labelling workflow, wherein 2-8 reporter ions are measured in MS2 spectra near 114 m/z.

label: 18O labeling
definitions: Quantification analysis using labeling based on 18O-enriched H2O.

label: TMT-tag
definitions: Quantification analysis using the Thermo Fisher tandem mass tag labelling workflow.

label: Dimethyl
definitions: Quantification analysis using chemical labeling by stable isotope dimethylation

label: Tag-based peptide identification
definitions: Peptide sequence tags are used as piece of information about a peptide obtained by tandem mass spectrometry.

label: de Novo sequencing
definitions: Analytical process that derives a peptide’s amino acid sequence from its tandem mass spectrum (MS/MS) without the assistance of a sequence database.

label: PTM identification
definitions: Identification of post-translational modifications (PTMs) of peptides/proteins in mass spectrum.

label: Peptide database search
definitions: Determination of best matches between MS/MS spectrum and a database of protein or nucleic acid sequences.

label: Blind peptide database search
definitions: Peptide database search for identification of known and unknown PTMs looking for mass difference mismatches.

label: Target-Decoy
definitions: Statistical estimation of false discovery rate from score distribution for peptide-spectrum-matches, following a peptide database search, and by comparison to search results with a database containing incorrect information.

label: Statistical inference
definitions: Analyse data in order to deduce properties of an underlying distribution or population.

label: Regression analysis
definitions: A statistical calculation to estimate the relationships among variables.

label: Metabolic network modelling
definitions: Model a metabolic network, for example, to reconstruct pathways or to simulate metabolism.

label: SNP annotation
definitions: Predict the effect or function of an individual single nucleotide polymorphism (SNP).

label: Ab-initio gene prediction
definitions: Prediction of genes or gene components from first principles, i.e. without reference to existing genes.

label: Homology-based gene prediction
definitions: Prediction of genes or gene components by reference to homologous genes.

label: Statistical modelling
definitions: Construction of a statistical model, or a set of assumptions around some observed data, usually by describing a set of probability distributions which approximate the distribution of data.

label: Molecular surface comparison
definitions: Compare two or more molecular surfaces.

label: Gene functional annotation
definitions: Annotate one or more sequences with functional information, such as cellular processes or metaobolic pathways, by reference to a controlled vocabulary - invariably the Gene Ontology (GO).

label: Variant filtering
definitions: Variant filtering is used to eliminate false positive variants based for example on base calling quality, strand and position information, and mapping info.

label: Differential binding analysis
definitions: Differential binding analysis identifies binding sites in nucleic acid sequences that are statistically significantly differentially bound between sample groups.

label: RNA-Seq analysis
definitions: Analyze data from RNA-seq experiments.

label: Mass spectrum visualisation
definitions: Visualise, format or render a mass spectrum.

label: Filtering
definitions: Filter a set of files or data items according to some property.

label: Reference identification
definitions: Identification of the best reference for mapping for a specific dataset from a list of potential references, when performing genetic variation analysis.

label: Ion counting
definitions: Label-free quantification by integration of ion current (ion counting).

label: Isotope-coded protein label
definitions: Chemical tagging free amino groups of intact proteins with stable isotopes.

label: Metabolic labeling
definitions: Labeling all proteins and (possibly) all amino acids using C-13 or N-15 enriched grown medium or feed.

This includes N-15 metabolic labeling (labeling all proteins and (possibly) all amino acids using N-15 enriched grown medium or feed) and C-13 metabolic labeling (labeling all proteins and (possibly) all amino acids using C-13 enriched grown medium or feed).

label: Cross-assembly
definitions: Construction of a single sequence assembly of all reads from different samples, typically as part of a comparative metagenomic analysis.

label: Sample comparison
definitions: The comparison of samples from a metagenomics study, for example, by comparison of metagenome shotgun reads or assembled contig sequences, by comparison of functional profiles, or some other method.

label: Differential protein expression analysis
definitions: The analysis, using proteomics techniques, to identify proteins whose encoding genes are differentially expressed under a given experimental setup.

label: Multiple sample visualisation
definitions: Visualise, format or render data arising from an analysis of multiple samples from a metagenomics/community experiment.

label: Ancestral reconstruction
definitions: The extrapolation of empirical characteristics of individuals or populations, backwards in time, to their common ancestors.
Ancestral reconstruction is often used to recover possible ancestral character states of ancient, extinct organisms.

label: PTM localisation
definitions: Site localisation of post-translational modifications in peptide or protein mass spectra.

label: Service management
definitions: Operations concerning the handling and use of other tools.

label: Service discovery
definitions: An operation supporting the browsing or discovery of other tools and services.

label: Service composition
definitions: An operation supporting the aggregation of other services (at least two) into a funtional unit, for the automation of some task.

label: Service invocation
definitions: An operation supporting the calling (invocation) of other tools and services.

label: Weighted correlation network analysis
definitions: A data mining method typically used for studying biological networks based on pairwise correlations between variables.

label: Protein identification
definitions: Identification of protein, for example from one or more peptide identifications by tandem mass spectrometry.

label: Text annotation
definitions: Text annotation is the operation of adding notes, data and metadata, recognised entities and concepts, and their relations to a text (such as a scientific article).

label: Collapsing methods
definitions: A method whereby data on several variants are "collapsed" into a single covariate based on regions such as genes.

Genome-wide association studies (GWAS) analyse a genome-wide set of genetic variants in different individuals to see if any variant is associated with a trait. Traditional association techniques can lack the power to detect the significance of rare variants individually, or measure their compound effect (rare variant burden).  "Collapsing methods" were developed to overcome these problems.

label: miRNA expression analysis
definitions: The analysis of microRNAs (miRNAs) : short, highly conserved small noncoding RNA molecules that are naturally occurring plant and animal genomes.

label: Read summarisation
definitions: Counting and summarising the number of short sequence reads that map to genomic features.

label: In vitro selection
definitions: A technique whereby molecules with desired properties and function are isolated from libraries of random molecules, through iterative cycles of selection, amplification, and mutagenesis.

label: Rarefaction
definitions: The calculation of species richness for a number of individual samples, based on plots of the number of species as a function of the number of samples (rarefaction curves).

label: Read binning
definitions: An operation which groups reads or contigs and assigns them to operational taxonomic units.
Binning methods use one or a combination of compositional features or sequence similarity.

label: Quantification
definitions: Counting and measuring experimentally determined observations into quantities.

label: RNA-Seq quantification
definitions: Quantification of data arising from RNA-Seq high-throughput sequencing, typically the quantification of transcript abundances durnig transcriptome analysis in a gene expression study.

label: Spectral library search
definitions: Match experimentally measured mass spectrum to a spectrum in a spectral library or database.

label: Sorting
definitions: Sort a set of files or data items according to some property.

label: Natural product identification
definitions: Mass spectra identification of compounds that are produced by living systems. Including polyketides, terpenoids, phenylpropanoids, alkaloids and antibiotics.

label: Differentially-methylated region identification
definitions: Identify and assess specific genes or regulatory regions of interest that are differentially methylated.
